name: Light Spaghetti Salad
author: TXLADY3K
summary: I had this at a family reunion. Several years later I was wanting this and played around until I came up with this recipe. I am always asked to bring it to potlucks at work.
ingredients: 1  red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1 (16 ounce) bottle fat-free Italian salad dressing
1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian salad dressing mix (such as Good Seasons®)
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Drain and rinse in cold water
Place spaghetti into a large salad bowl and toss with red onion, red bell pepper, cucumber, tomato, Italian salad dressing, salad dressing mix, and salt
Chill before serving; salad is better the longer it chills
